01_data_basics/02_proportion/02_list_proportion_between_v2

The lengths (in centimeters) of 10 lizards were recorded.

\[\mathbf{x} = 13, 12, 14, 18, 15, 14, 14, 13, 19, 13 \]

You can download the data as a CSV file (for importing into a spreadsheet or R): lizard_data.csv


  1. What proportion of the measurements are inside 11.5 cm to 19.5 cm? In other words, determine \(\text{prop}[\mathbf{x}>11.5\texttt{ AND } \mathbf{x}<19.5]\). In other words, determine \(\text{prop}[11.5<\mathbf{x}<19.5]\).
  2. What proportion of the measurements are outside 14.5 cm to 15.5 cm? In other words, determine \(\text{prop}[\mathbf{x}<14.5\texttt{ OR } \mathbf{x}>15.5]\). In other words, determine \(\text{prop}[\texttt{NOT}(14.5<\mathbf{x}<15.5)]\).
  3. What proportion of the measurements are closer than 3.5 cm from 14 cm? In other words, determine \(\text{prop}\left[\big|\mathbf{x}-14\big|<3.5\right]\).
  4. What proportion of the measurements are farther than 1.5 cm from 15 cm? In other words, determine \(\text{prop}\left[\big|\mathbf{x}-15\big|>1.5\right]\).
  5. Determine a half-integer radius \(r\) of an interval with center 17 cm such that \(\text{prop}\left[\big|\mathbf{x}-17\big|<r\right] ~=~ 0.3\).
  6. Determine a half-integer radius \(r\) of an interval with center 16 cm such that \(\text{prop}\left[\big|\mathbf{x}-16\big|>r\right] ~=~ 0.9\).
